thread.title: MN construction sector loses 2,000 jobs in July
thread.title_full: MN construction sector loses 2,000 jobs in July

author: Karlee Weinmann
title: MN construction sector loses 2,000 jobs in July
text:
Home / News / Business & Economy / MN construction sector loses 2,000 jobs in July MN construction sector loses 2,000 jobs in July By: Karlee Weinmann August 20, 2015 10:04 am 0 
Minnesota construction companies lost 2,000 jobs in July, partially reversing gains made during spring months and earlier in the summer. 
Overall, the state’s employers shaved 3,900 jobs for the month, according to seasonally adjusted data from the Minnesota Department of Employment and Economic Development. Still, year-over-year gains amount to 43,719 jobs – a growth rate of 1.5 percent. 
Minnesota’s seasonally adjusted unemployment rate ticked up to 4 percent in July, up from 3.9 percent a month earlier. It still falls well short of the 5.9 percent nationwide rate. 
The leisure and hospitality sector, down 3,700 jobs in July, was the only one to cut more than construction. Trade, transportation and utilities dropped 1,700 positions, while education and health services lost 1,200. Manufacturing outfits lopped off 300 and other services lost 100. 
Government, on the other hand, posted 2,700 new jobs in July, outmatching gains in professional and business services – up 1,400 – and financial activities, which added 500 positions. Meanwhile, logging and mining employers tacked on 300 jobs and information added 100. 
Check back later for updates to this story.
